div.p: Open Enrollment begins on February 3rd, 2020 and will close on February 14th, 2020. Enrollment documents must be brought to the Freedom Academy office to finalize student enrollment. There will be a Lottery if needed on February 21st, 2020. The week of February 24th, 2020 families will be contacted to advise of enrollment status via mail.

Freedom Academy is an open enrollment school of choice. Any student eligible to attend an Arizona public school may enroll. Students will be enrolled during our open enrollment period, culminating with a lottery for grades in which not all enrolled students can be accommodated. After the open enrollment lottery, students will be enrolled on a first-come, first-serve basis.

Every attempt will be made to accommodate students seeking admission. However, due to the capacity of the schools physical plant, the school is limited in its student enrollment. When that limit is reached, a waiting list is established based on the students’ enrollment date and time.

Freedom Academy’s Board adopted policy is in alignment with the state recommendation that a child must reach the age of five (5) prior to September 1st to be eligible for kindergarten and must be age six (6) by September 1st to be eligible for the first grade. We make no exceptions to this policy.

Early advancement of high achieving students is not advised in most cases. Instead, the goal of Freedom Academy will be to individually enrich the program of a high functioning student instead of advancing them to a higher grade.

Parent group tours are provided throughout the year for prospective parents/guardians to have the opportunity to meet the administration, visit several classrooms, learn about policies and procedures and tour the campus. Tours last about an hour and a half. To reserve your spot, please click the button below. If your preferred date is not available, please contact the front office.

All visitors must enter through the Main Office. Please note that all tours are for adults only. No infants or children will be allowed in order to eliminate distractions while touring through classrooms.

Download the 2019-2020 Student Enrollment Packet OR 2020-2021 Student Enrollment Packet and complete all the forms contained in it. Bring the completed packet to the school with the following documentation:

ul.li: Arizona Residency Documentation Form and Proof of Residency document

One of the Following:
A certified copy of the pupil's birth certificate
Other reliable proof of the pupil's identify and age, including the pupil's baptismal certificate, an application for a social security number or original school registration records and an affidavit explaining the inability to provide a copy of the birth certificate.
A letter from the authorized representative of an agency having custody of the pupil pursuant to Title 8, Chapter 2 certifying that the pupil has been placed in custody of the agency as prescribed by law.

div.p: Some of the key resources we offer online for parents at our school include:

li.p: Make easy monthly auto payments towards fees, purchase uniforms, make one-time or monthly donations or make your tax credit donation here; all from the comfort of your home. Fast, convenient, easy. To donate or pay a fee, click the button below.
Our parent website not only shows you your child's grades, but will also allow you to review attendance and communicate with their teachers. To visit the site, click the buttons below.

To report your child absent, please click the button below. Absences must be report by 9:00 a.m. on the day of the absence to be considered EXCUSED for illness, family emergency or death in family. Personal days need to be called in but are still considered UNEXCUSED.

a.title: Early Release - Last Day of School

h3.a: Early Release - Last Day of School

div.p: To add an individual event to your personal calendar (iPhone, Outlook, etc.):

ol.li: Click on the name of the event.
The page will refresh, so scroll back down to the calendar.
Click on the blue Download ICS button.
To return to the main calendar, click the Return link to the right of the name of the event.

div.p: To add the entire calendar to Google Calendar:

ol.li: In Google Calendar, click on the Plus sign next to where it says Add a friend's calendar.

Choose the option From URL and paste the URL of the RSS link of Freedom's calendar (the site that pops up when you click the orange RSS button) or use the following: https://www.freedom-academy.com/DesktopModules/DNNGo_xEvent/Resource_Service.aspx?ModuleId=870&Token=RssFeeds&TabId=157&PortalId=0&language=en-US

A brief message will pop-up at the bottom of the screen saying Calendar has been added, and URL box will blank out again. You can either click on the link for the calendar under Settings on the left hand side to adjust what notifications you see from Freedom's calendar, or click the back arrow at the top next to Settings to go back to the calendar view.

input.name: dnn$ctr825$View_Index$ctl00$hfReply_UserName

td.p:
Good afternoon Freedom Community,
We have received guidance from the governor and the State Department of Education.
All schools in the state of Arizona are closed until further notice. We will continue to update you as we receive more information.
While schools are closed, we do feel that learning opportunities are important for our students and their families.
Freedom educators will do their best to reach out to their individual classes or as teams to let families know how they can continue learning from a distance during this time.
We are unclear as to when schools will reopen, although we will do our best to keep you informed as we learn more.
An important facet of this decision by Governor Ducey is limiting the spread of this virus by reducing contact with others. During this time, please stay at home and practice social distancing. We know that school closures will not work to minimize the risk of the spread of COVID-19 without our families taking appropriate precautions.
Here is an article from the CDC with some suggestions for keeping your household free from COVID-19.
If you are in a position where you are unable to quarantine your children or your family, Ridgeline Academy (our sister school) will be providing childcare during this time through Innovation Learning. You will need to sign up for the program to ensure proper staffing during this challenging time.
The link for the program can be found at: https://innovationlearning.com
Thank you for your patience, understanding, and cooperation.

input.name: dnn$ctr833$View_Index$ctl00$hfReply_UserName

td.p:
Good afternoon Freedom Community,
We have received guidance from the governor and the State Department of Education.
All schools in the state of Arizona are closed until further notice. We will continue to update you as we receive more information.
While schools are closed, we do feel that learning opportunities are important for our students and their families.
Freedom educators will do their best to reach out to their individual classes or as teams to let families know how they can continue learning from a distance during this time.
We are unclear as to when schools will reopen, although we will do our best to keep you informed as we learn more.
An important facet of this decision by Governor Ducey is limiting the spread of this virus by reducing contact with others. During this time, please stay at home and practice social distancing. We know that school closures will not work to minimize the risk of the spread of COVID-19 without our families taking appropriate precautions.
Here is an article from the CDC with some suggestions for keeping your household free from COVID-19.
If you are in a position where you are unable to quarantine your children or your family, Ridgeline Academy (our sister school) will be providing childcare during this time through Innovation Learning. You will need to sign up for the program to ensure proper staffing during this challenging time.
The link for the program can be found at: https://innovationlearning.com
Thank you for your patience, understanding, and cooperation.
